channel.title: My Java Programs
channel.description:
Well now that there is a General Programming section, I can post these here rather than in General Discussion.
[size=20pt]Chat Server By Davidi2[/size] [u][b]Current Features:[/b][/u]
[ul][li]Connect[/li] [li]Chat, all can see[/li] [li]Simple GUI[/li] [li]Username Editing[/li] [li]Color Coding[/li] [li]User List + Updating[/li] [li]Ban[/li][/ul]
[u][b]Features to Come:[/b][/u]
[ul][li]Other Commands[/li] [li]Private Messaging[/li][/ul]
This works on the same principles as a RSPS, as it hosts a server at your IP (and a port of your choosing), and allows my client to connect to it from anywhere with internet access. [img]http://img6.imageshack.us/img6/5772/clienthj.png[/img] Source: http://pastebin.com/cLWSYgBQ
Now if you want to download them all without any of that C+P, here you go: (includes class files) [b][u]ChatClient:[/u][/b] http://uppit.com/v/RNMP8IAG [u][b]ChatServer:[/b][/u] http://uppit.com/v/6JN0VT04
[size=20pt]Alien Attack[/size] Well I decided to make a game with Java. (Finally)
This game is one of those where the aliens come in rows and you need to shoot them before they pass the line. I also implemented some of the features of other games, such as the pong game where you try to hit all of the blocks with a ball bounced with a paddle. The game has power ups, and gets rather hard in the last levels. There is a score algorithm as well. More information can be found here: [url=http://davidscape.com/AlienAttack/index.html]Alien Attack HomePage[/url]
Pictures: (Please note I am no good at computer drawings, so all of the sprites are ugly. I even forced my brother to draw the aliens) [b]EDIT: If you can make better pictures, send them to me! Keep the same image dimensions. Keep the plane images transparent background. [/b] [img]http://img34.imageshack.us/img34/7117/starto.png[/img] [img]http://img97.imageshack.us/img97/5168/26698118.png[/img] [img]http://img51.imageshack.us/img51/6882/78396340.png[/img] [img]http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/6873/83766350.png[/img]
If you want to download everything (sprites included): http://uppit.com/v/V40JOMD Here is the entire code: http://pastebin.com/at1BwdSk
[size=20pt]Map Editor[/size] I am creating a game similar to the first Mario Bros games. The ones where you avoid the barrels and try to reach the top of the level by climbing ladders etc. Before I even started making the game, I decided that I should allow people to make their own maps for the game, other then the normal ones that it would come with.
So let me start explaining the program. You start out with a blank black slate, and a Control Panel with some options on it. The levels are 33x33 grid based, and each grid space (I will use the term tile) can be taken up by almost any tile in the Control Panel. The tiles are:
[ul][li]Block - Walkable tile[/li] [li]Water - Not walkable, kills on contact from top or sides[/li] [li]Ladder - Climbable and walkable[/li] [li]Spike - Not walkable, kills on contact from top[/li] [li]Blank - Not walkable, player falls when in contact[/li] [li]Player start - Represents the player start position[/li][/ul]
Just to understand more, you beat the level when you reach the door, which has yet to be added. I'm still deciding how that part will work with the game, so I haven't put it in yet.
[b]For MoparScapers: You place tiles by selecting the corresponding tile in the Control Panel, and clicking/dragging the mouse over the area you want the tile added.[/b]
Some more information:
[ul][li]The tiles are images in the format [b]M[/b]ap[b]E[/b]ditor[b]I[/b]mage, a custom file extension for this application. (*.mei)[/li] [li]This application also supporst saving and loading, map backup, and corrupt file detection. The saved [b]M[/b]ap[b]E[/b]ditor[b]M[/b]apdata, a custom file extension for this application. (*.mem)[/li] [li]You can shrink the Control Panel by pressing hide, or clicking the exit button on it. The Control Panel will not close until the main panel closes however.[/li][/ul]
Now here is the source code: http://pastebin.com/zdiA6TzX
Images:
[img]http://img51.imageshack.us/img51/8528/94326343.png[/img] [img]http://img8.imageshack.us/img8/3118/10274652.png[/img] [img]http://img525.imageshack.us/img525/1761/35241192.png[/img] [img]http://img268.imageshack.us/img268/6267/31291879.png[/img]
[b]You can also download the executable jar with all images and folders here: [url=http://uppit.com/v/818CH601]Version 1[/url][/b]
[size=20pt]Mass Replace[/size]Ok what this program does it take any file of your choosing, and replace all occurrences of a string in that file and replace it with another. This is useful for things such as renaming variables from a lot of different classes.
EDIT: I finished multiple file selection, which can replace words in all files.
Features:
[ul][li]Multiple file selection for easier replacement - DONE[/li] [li]GUI - DONE[/li] [li]RegEx searching - DONE[/li] [li]File overwrite - DONE[/li] [li]Saves a backup before editing - DONE[/li] [li]Select files from more then one folder (just keep adding them with the button) - DONE[/li][/ul]
Source: http://pastebin.com/tX0afAQQ Here's everything together: EXECUTABLE Jar: http://uppit.com/v/ESLTZP5E (9kb)

Probably like 20 more lines.

item.title: My Java Programs
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Well now that there is a General Programming section, I can post these here rather than in General Discussion.

[size=20pt]Chat Server
By Davidi2[/size]
Current Features:

[ul][li]Connect[/li]
[li]Chat, all can see[/li]
[li]Simple GUI[/li]
[li]Username Editing[/li]
[li]Color Coding[/li]
[li]User List + Updating[/li]
[li]Ban[/li][/ul]

Features to Come:

[ul][li]Other Commands[/li]
[li]Private Messaging[/li][/ul]

This works on the same principles as a RSPS, as it hosts a server at your IP (and a port of your choosing), and allows my client to connect to it from anywhere with internet access.

Source: http://pastebin.com/cLWSYgBQ

Now if you want to download them all without any of that C+P, here you go: (includes class files)
ChatClient: http://uppit.com/v/RNMP8IAG
ChatServer: http://uppit.com/v/6JN0VT04

[size=20pt]Alien Attack[/size]
Well I decided to make a game with Java. (Finally)

This game is one of those where the aliens come in rows and you need to shoot them before they pass the line. I also implemented some of the features of other games, such as the pong game where you try to hit all of the blocks with a ball bounced with a paddle. The game has power ups, and gets rather hard in the last levels. There is a score algorithm as well.
More information can be found here: Alien Attack HomePage

Pictures: (Please note I am no good at computer drawings, so all of the sprites are ugly. I even forced my brother to draw the aliens)
EDIT: If you can make better pictures, send them to me! Keep the same image dimensions. Keep the plane images transparent background.



If you want to download everything (sprites included): http://uppit.com/v/V40JOMD
Here is the entire code:
http://pastebin.com/at1BwdSk

[size=20pt]Map Editor[/size]
I am creating a game similar to the first Mario Bros games. The ones where you avoid the barrels and try to reach the top of the level by climbing ladders etc. Before I even started making the game, I decided that I should allow people to make their own maps for the game, other then the normal ones that it would come with.

So let me start explaining the program.
You start out with a blank black slate, and a Control Panel with some options on it. The levels are 33x33 grid based, and each grid space (I will use the term tile) can be taken up by almost any tile in the Control Panel. The tiles are:

[ul][li]Block - Walkable tile[/li]
[li]Water - Not walkable, kills on contact from top or sides[/li]
[li]Ladder - Climbable and walkable[/li]
[li]Spike - Not walkable, kills on contact from top[/li]
[li]Blank - Not walkable, player falls when in contact[/li]
[li]Player start - Represents the player start position[/li][/ul]

Just to understand more, you beat the level when you reach the door, which has yet to be added. I’m still deciding how that part will work with the game, so I haven’t put it in yet.

For MoparScapers: You place tiles by selecting the corresponding tile in the Control Panel, and clicking/dragging the mouse over the area you want the tile added.

Some more information:

[ul][li]The tiles are images in the format MapEditorImage, a custom file extension for this application. (.mei)[/li]
[li]This application also supporst saving and loading, map backup, and corrupt file detection. The saved MapEditorMapdata, a custom file extension for this application. (.mem)[/li]
[li]You can shrink the Control Panel by pressing hide, or clicking the exit button on it. The Control Panel will not close until the main panel closes however.[/li][/ul]

Now here is the source code:
http://pastebin.com/zdiA6TzX

Images:




You can also download the executable jar with all images and folders here: Version 1

[size=20pt]Mass Replace[/size]Ok what this program does it take any file of your choosing, and replace all occurrences of a string in that file and replace it with another. This is useful for things such as renaming variables from a lot of different classes.

EDIT: I finished multiple file selection, which can replace words in all files.

Features:

[ul][li]Multiple file selection for easier replacement - DONE[/li]
[li]GUI - DONE[/li]
[li]RegEx searching - DONE[/li]
[li]File overwrite - DONE[/li]
[li]Saves a backup before editing - DONE[/li]
[li]Select files from more then one folder (just keep adding them with the button) - DONE[/li][/ul]

Source:
http://pastebin.com/tX0afAQQ
Here’s everything together:
EXECUTABLE Jar: http://uppit.com/v/ESLTZP5E (9kb)

Read full topic
